LocalizedStrings.enGB:
You've learned a way to increase the number of spells you can prepare per day.
Benefit: You can prepare four more spells per day of 1st, 2nd, and 3rd levels each. This ability only affects arcanist spellbooks.

You've mastered a way to increase the number of spells you can prepare per day.
Benefit: You can prepare four more spells per day of 7th, 8th, and 9th levels each. This ability only affects arcanist spellbooks.

You've studied a way to increase the number of spells you can prepare per day.
Benefit: You can prepare four more spells per day of 4th, 5th, and 6th levels each. This ability only affects arcanist spellbooks.
You wrap your body in force, gaining a +2 deflection bonus to AC. At caster level 6th and every 6 caster levels thereafter, this deflection bonus increases by +1 (to a maximum of +5 at 18th level).
You wrap your body in force, gaining a +2 deflection bonus to AC. At caster level 6th and every 6 caster levels thereafter, this deflection bonus increases by +1 (to a maximum of +5 at 18th level).

This spell functions like mage armor except you gain a +6 armor bonus. This bonus does not stack with other sources that grant an armor bonus.[LONGSTART]

An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds the subject of a mage armor spell, providing a +4 armor bonus to AC.
Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance. or speed redution. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal amror.[LONGEND]

This spell functions like mage armor except you gain a +6 armor bonus. This bonus does not stack with other sources that grant an armor bonus.[LONGSTART]

Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance. or speed redution. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal amror.[LONGEND]

Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance. or speed redution. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal amror.[LONGEND]

This spell functions like mage armor except you gain a +10 armor bonus. This bonus does not stack with other sources that grant an armor bonus.[LONGSTART]

Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance. or speed redution. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal amror.[LONGEND]

Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance. or speed redution. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal amror.[LONGEND]

This spell functions like shield, but its duration is longer and it can be employed like a tower shield for cover.[LONGSTART]

Shield creates an invisible shield of force that hovers in front of you. It negates magic missile attacks directed at you. The disk als oprovides a +4 shield bonus to AC. This bonus applies against incorporeal touch attacks, since it is a force effect. The shield has no armor check penalty or arcane spell failure.[LONGEND]

This spell functions like shield, but its duration is longer and it can be employed like a tower shield for cover.[LONGSTART]

Shield creates an invisible shield of force that hovers in front of you. It negates magic missile attacks directed at you. The disk als oprovides a +4 shield bonus to AC. This bonus applies against incorporeal touch attacks, since it is a force effect. The shield has no armor check penalty or arcane spell failure.[LONGEND]

Trained under great masters who preached the simple truththat two are better than one when it comes to weapons, the two-weapon warrior is a terror when his hands are full. From paired daggers to exoticdouble weapons, all combinations come equally alive in his skilled hands.

At 19th level, when a two-weapon warrior makes a full attack with both weapons, every creature that hits him with a melee attack before the beginning of his next turn provokes an attack of opportunity from the warrior.

At 3rd level, when a two-weapon warrior makes a full attack with both weapons, he gains a +1 dodge bonus to AC against melee attacks until the beginning of his next turn. This bonus increases by +1 every four levels after 3rd.

At 3rd level, when a two-weapon warrior makes a full attack with both weapons, he gains a +1 dodge bonus to AC against melee attacks until the beginning of his next turn. This bonus increases by +1 every four levels after 3rd.

At 17th level, when a two-weapon warrior hits an opponent with both weapons, he can make a disarm or sunder attempt (or trip, if one or both weapons can be used to trip) against that opponent as an immediate action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
At 9th level, a two-weapon warrior may, as a standard action, make one attack with both his primary and secondary weapons. The penalties for attacking with two weapons apply normally.
At 13th level, when a two-weapon warrior makes an attack of opportunity, he may attack once with both his primary and secondary weapons. The penalties for attacking with two weapons apply normally.

At 11th level, the attack penalties for fighting with two weapons are reduced by –1 for a two-weapon warrior. Alternatively, he may use a one-handed weapon in his off-hand, treating it as if it were a light weapon with the normal light weapon penalties.

At 15th level, the penalties for fighting with two weapons are reduced by an additional –1 for a two-weapon warrior. This benefit stacks with improved balance. If he is using a one-handed weapon in his off hand, treating it as a light weapon, he uses the normal light weapon penalties.

At 5th level, a two-weapon warrior gains a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls when making a full attack with two weapons or a double weapon. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels after 5th.
